title: Possible suggestion for the Michigan M
content:
I tried what the font to try and determine what font would closely resemble the Michigan M, but the closest I got was that this a a modified Colossalis BQ with a touch of Beton, but I could be wrong. Is there another possibility that I am overlooking?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152143im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Untitled_5532.png)

 [‹ Sure, that's easy for you - but not for me](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152143/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43839 "Go to previous forum topic") [MTV slab serif ID help... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152143/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43830 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Capnhud

comments.content: You could get close by filling [Princetown](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152143/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/princetown/?sample_text=M&sample_size=288) and adding a point to the middle.

Close? Heck that looks exactly like what they may have done. Ok I would have never even looked for something such as Princetownn I was trying to figure out what square slab serif that was. Thanks for pointing me in a very strong direction in the ID help Stephen.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here
